Class Person

java.lang.Object
Person
public class Person
extends java.lang.Object
Person Class The class is used manage personnel contact information Each parameter of the person class stores an array to allow for multiple accounts New entries are appended to the end of each array at the last index value Each account is assigned an account number automatically to allow search methods to Locate the same account even if details on that account are changed
Version:
2.00, 28 July 2021
Author:
Chris Joubert

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Person​(java.lang.String personType, java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String phoneNumber, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String street, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String region, java.lang.String country, java.lang.String postalCode)
    Person Class Initialization Method
    The method sets the initial values for the person class Account number is initialized a 1 and cannot be changed by the end user If initial account values are unknown this should be initialized as "none"

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void editPersonAccount()
    Edit Personnel Account Method
    The method requested the user to select an account type and then a specific account.
    int getAccountNumber​(java.lang.String accType, boolean isNewAccount)
    Get Account Number Method
    Requests the user select an account type and then displays a list of accounts associated with that account type If no matching account types are found the user is requested to create a new account The account number is returned after an account is selected or created

    Get Account Type Index Method
    Returns an array containing all the index numbers of accounts that match the same account type

    Returns all account data as a single string for saving in a txt file

    Get Saved Data Method
    The method converts saved data stored in a txt file to parameter data This method overwrites any data that might have previously been added as values
    java.lang.String getValidEmail​(java.lang.String tempPersonType, java.lang.String currentEmail)
    Get Valid Email Method
    Requests the user enter a valid email address The method confirms the entry contains an "@" and is at least 6 chars long
    java.lang.String nameToString​(int accNum)
    Name To String Method
    The method converts the name and surname of an account to a single string containing both values
    java.lang.String setCreateOrEdit()
    Set Personnel Type Method

    Set New Account Method
    Used to create a new account
    int setNewPerson​(java.lang.String accountType)
    Set New Personnel Method
    Used to create a new account and append it to the current class arrays It detects if an account currently exists or does not If no account is detected, the index position 0 is overwritten Alternatively the new account is appended to the existing arrays

  • Constructor Details

    • Person

      public Person​(java.lang.String personType, java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String phoneNumber, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String street, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String region, java.lang.String country, java.lang.String postalCode)
      Person Class Initialization Method
      The method sets the initial values for the person class Account number is initialized a 1 and cannot be changed by the end user If initial account values are unknown this should be initialized as "none"
      Parameters:
      personType - String, contains account type of first account
      firstName - String, contains first name of first account
      lastName - String, contains surname of first account
      phoneNumber - String, contains phone number of first account
      email - String, contains email of first account
      street - String, contains street address of first account
      city - String, contains city name of first account
      region - String, contains province name of first account
      country - String, contains country name of first account
      postalCode - String, contains postal code number of first account
      Since:
      version 1.00
      See Also:
      setNewPerson(java.lang.String)

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString​(int accNum)
      toString Method
      The method converts an the parameters of a single user account to a String
      Parameters:
      accNum - int account number of the account to be displayed
      Returns:
      String containing the data from all the attributes of the account
      Since:
      version 1.00

    • nameToString

      public java.lang.String nameToString​(int accNum)
      Name To String Method
      The method converts the name and surname of an account to a single string containing both values
      Parameters:
      accNum - int account number of the account to be displayed
      Returns:
      String containing the first and last name of the specified account
      Since:
      version 1.00

    • editPersonAccount

      public void editPersonAccount()
      Edit Personnel Account Method
      The method requested the user to select an account type and then a specific account. The user is then provided with a list of values to edit The selected value is then altered according to the user's input If non of the selected account type exist, the user is prompted to create one Account numbers are never changed to help locate the same account even if values are changed
      Since:
      version 1.00
      See Also:
      getAllData(), stringArrayToString(java.lang.String[])

    • getSavedData

      public void getSavedData​(java.lang.String savedData)
      Get Saved Data Method
      The method converts saved data stored in a txt file to parameter data This method overwrites any data that might have previously been added as values
      Parameters:
      savedData - String containing all account information
      Since:
      version 2.00

    • getAccTypeIndex

      public int[] getAccTypeIndex​(java.lang.String[] accountType, java.lang.String accountTypeNeeded)
      Get Account Type Index Method
      Returns an array containing all the index numbers of accounts that match the same account type
      Parameters:
      accountType - String[] array containing all account types to be filtered
      accountTypeNeeded - String the value to be filtered for
      Returns:
      accountArrayIndex int[] containing an array of all the index values of account that match the same account type
      Since:
      version 2.00
      See Also:
      getAccountNumber(java.lang.String,boolean), editPersonAccount()

    • getAllData

      public java.lang.String getAllData()
      Get All Data Method
      Returns all account data as a single string for saving in a txt file
      Returns:
      allDataToReturn String returns all data from the class and it's parameters in a single string
      Since:
      version 2.00
      See Also:
      stringArrayToString(java.lang.String[]), intArrayToString(int[])

    • getLastName

      public java.lang.String getLastName​(int accNum)
      Get Last Name Method
      Returns all account data as a single string for saving in a txt file
      Parameters:
      accNum - int the account number of the last name to be retrieved
      Returns:
      lastNameToReturn String the Last Name value of the account associated with the account number
      Since:
      version 1.00

    • getValidEmail

      public java.lang.String getValidEmail​(java.lang.String tempPersonType, java.lang.String currentEmail)
      Get Valid Email Method
      Requests the user enter a valid email address The method confirms the entry contains an "@" and is at least 6 chars long
      Parameters:
      tempPersonType - String contains the account type to be displayed when requesting an email
      currentEmail - String contains the pre-filled value for the email
      Returns:
      emailToReturn String containing phone number entered / or "" if the user canceled entry
      Since:
      version 2.00

    • getAccountNumber

      public int getAccountNumber​(java.lang.String accType, boolean isNewAccount)
      Get Account Number Method
      Requests the user select an account type and then displays a list of accounts associated with that account type If no matching account types are found the user is requested to create a new account The account number is returned after an account is selected or created
      Parameters:
      accType - String contains the account type filter and display related account of
      isNewAccount - boolean overwrites request to select an account and skips to account creations process if set to true
      Returns:
      accNumber int containing account number of the selected account / or -1 if the user canceled entry
      Since:
      version 2.00

    • setPersonType

      public static java.lang.String setPersonType()
      Set Personnel Type Method
      Requests the user select an account type
      Returns:
      personSelection String containing account type selected
      Since:
      version 2.00
      See Also:
      editPersonAccount()

    • setPersonType

      public static java.lang.String setPersonType​(java.lang.String displayRequest)
      Set Personnel Type Method
      Requests the user select an account type
      Parameters:
      displayRequest - String sets the request to be displayed to the user
      Returns:
      personSelection String containing account type selected
      Since:
      version 2.00
      See Also:
      editPersonAccount()

    • setCreateOrEdit

      public java.lang.String setCreateOrEdit()
      Set Personnel Type Method
      Displays a selection to create or edit existing accounts The option to edit is removed is it's detected that no accounts currently exist
      Returns:
      personSelection String containing the selection to edit or create a new account
      Since:
      version 1.00

    • setNewAccount

      public int setNewAccount​(java.lang.String accType)
      Set New Account Method
      Used to create a new account
      Parameters:
      accType - String contains account type to assign to the new account
      Returns:
      getAccountNumber Int - sets new account
      Since:
      version 2.00
      See Also:
      getAccountNumber(java.lang.String,boolean)

    • setNewPerson

      public int setNewPerson​(java.lang.String accountType)
      Set New Personnel Method
      Used to create a new account and append it to the current class arrays It detects if an account currently exists or does not If no account is detected, the index position 0 is overwritten Alternatively the new account is appended to the existing arrays
      Parameters:
      accountType - String contains account type to assign to the new account
      Returns:
      accountNum int contains account number of new account / returns -1 if the process was canceled
      Since:
      version 1.00
      See Also:
      editPersonAccount()
